structure.unit: STATE LIBRARIES -- LIBRARIANS -- STATE ARCHIVES AND RECORDS

law.catch_line: Museum's ability to acquire title to property held by loan or otherwise.

text.section: If property is on loan to a museum pursuant to a loan agreement and the loan term expires, then the museum may initiate proceedings, pursuant to KRS 171.840, to cause title to the property to vest in the museum.

After a museum has held property for seven (7) years, other than by the terms of a loan agreement, that museum may initiate proceedings, pursuant to KRS 171.840, to cause title to the property to vest in the museum.

law.history: Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 368, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1996.
